summary: Richard N. Billings was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports that list Billings as an employee. These reports detail his employment with the SCAS during various periods in 1978, including April, August, and December. The reports list his name, salary, and gross pay during those periods.
significance: Richard N. Billings' significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS), indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination. The provided documents confirm his role as a staff member within the committee, contributing to the overall effort of the investigation.
